clinical_study.brief_title: Humanized CAR-T Therapy for Treatment of B Cell Malignancy
clinical_study.official_title: Humanized CAR-T Therapy for Treatment of Recurrent or Refractory B Cell Malignancy by Targeting CD19

lead_sponsor.agency: Kai Lin Xu; Jun Nian Zheng

brief_summary.textblock: The present study evaluates the safety and efficacy of humanized Chimeric antigen receptor T cells (CAR-T) in treating recurrent or refractory B cell malignancy targeting CD19 with a humanized scFv. All participants will receive autologous chimeric antigen receptor engineered T cells.

detailed_description.textblock: CD19 has been extensively evaluated as a therapeutic target for recurrent or refractory B cell malignancy by chimeric antigen receptor T cell therapy, the single chain antibody sequence (scFv) against CD19 derived from a mouse hybridoma was widely employed. However, the immunogenicity of the mouse scFv sequence might be one of the reasons that CAR-T cells cannot persist in vivo for long. In present study investigators replace the mouse-derived scFv with a a humanized one and evaluate its safety and efficacy.

primary_outcome.measure: CAR-T cells persistence in peripheral blood
primary_outcome.description: The presence of CAR T cells in patients' peripheral blood will be quantified with real time qPCR

secondary_outcome.measure: B cell number and immunoglobulins in peripheral blood
secondary_outcome.description: The number of B cells and immunoglobulins in peripheral blood will be evaluated by routine methods

arm_group.description: In interventional studies, patients enrolled will receive autologous 2nd generation CAR-T cells, which contain a humanized single chain antibody sequence against CD19.

intervention.description: Patients will be infused with autologous CAR-T infusion in a dose escalating manner.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ageâ‰¥3 at the time of consent
- Survival time>12 weeks
- B cell hematological malignancies by pathological examination
- Chemotherapy failure or recurrent B cell malignancy
- Creatinine< 2.5mg/dl
- Glutamic-pyruvic transaminase, glutamic oxalacetic transaminase< 3 fold of normal level
- Karnofsky Performance Status>50% at the time of screening
- Bilirubin<2.0mg/dl
- Adequate pulmonary, renal, hepatic, and cardiac function
- Fail in autologous or allogenic haemopoietic stem cell transplantation
- Free of leukocytes removal contraindications
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or nursing women
- Active hepatitis B, active hepatitis C, or any human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection at the time of screening
- Previous treatment with any gene therapy product
- Abnormal vital signs
- Highly allergic constitution or history of severe allergies, especially allergy to interleukin-2
- General infection or local severe infection, or other infection that is not controlled
- Dysfunction in lung, heart, kidney and brain.
- Severe autoimmune diseases
- other symptoms that are not applicable for CAR-T
